citations.narrative:
During inspection, a chinchilla was observed loose in the building and was promptly caught by the licensee and returned
to their enclosure. The enclosure for the chinchilla had not been securely latched, and the chinchilla was able to escape. It
did not appear that the chinchilla was injured or stressed when it was returned to the enclosure, but trauma or death can
occur when the enclosure isn't fully latched and the animal escapes their primary enclosure. Handling of all animals shall
be done as expeditiously and carefully as possible in a manner that does not cause behavioral stress, physical harm or
unnecessary discomfort.
Corrected during inspection on 14 January 2024
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee.
n

narrative:
2.131(b)(1) 
   
Handling of animals. 
During inspection, a chinchilla was observed loose in the building and was promptly caught by the licensee and returned 
to their enclosure. The enclosure for the chinchilla had not been securely latched, and the chinchilla was able to escape. It 
did not appear that the chinchilla was injured or stressed when it was returned to the enclosure, but trauma or death can 
occur when the enclosure isn't fully latched and the animal escapes their primary enclosure. Handling of all animals shall 
be done as expeditiously and carefully as possible in a manner that does not cause behavioral stress, physical harm or 
unnecessary discomfort.  
 
Corrected during inspection on 14 January 2024 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee. 
 
 n
